# [[water]] {{gloss|liquid H<sub>2</sub>O}}<!-- this formatting displays better and it can be more generally used than subscript numbers like "₂", it's also applied in the article https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chemical_formula -->

#: {{syn|hu|dihidrogén-monoxid}}

#* '''1844''', [[w:Sándor Petőfi|Sándor Petőfi]], ''János vitéz'',<sup>[http://mek.oszk.hu/01000/01010/01010.htm]</sup> chapter 4, stanza 1, translated by John Ridland:<sup>[http://www.magyarulbabelben.net/works/hu/Pet%C5%91fi_S%C3%A1ndor-1823/J%C3%A1nos_Vit%C3%A9z_%28teljes%29/en/58450-John_the_Valiant_%28complete%29]</sup>
#*: Mikorra a patak '''vize''' tükörré lett, / Melybe ezer csillag ragyogása nézett: / Jancsi Iluskáék kertje alatt vala; / Maga sem tudta, hogy mikép jutott oda.
#*:: When the brook made a looking glass of its '''water''', / In whose surface a thousand stars were a-glitter, / Johnny was standing at the foot of Nell’s yard; / Though to tell how he'd come to it would have been hard.
# {{lb|hu|dialectal}} [[flood]]
#: {{syn|hu|árvíz}}
# [[drinking water]], [[mineral water]]
#: {{syn|hu|ivóvíz}}
# [[bathwater]]
#: {{syn|hu|fürdővíz}}
# [[sweat]]
#: {{syn|hu|izzadság|veríték|verejték}}
#* '''1939''', {{w|Jenő Rejtő}}, ''A Nevada szelleme'',<sup>[http://mek.oszk.hu/01500/01598/01598.htm#2]</sup> chapter 2:
#*: Ez a férfi csakúgy sugározta magából a durva, nyugati ember kegyetlen erejét és vadságát. Bár folyt a '''víz''' róla, és inge izzadtan tapadt a testéhez, vasegészségében bízva egyetlen hajtásra itta ki a jeges whiskyt. A kocsmáros kiment, hogy a lóról gondoskodjék.

===Etymology===
Common to West and North Germanic: cognate with {{cog|ang|catt}}, {{cog|non|kǫttr}} ({{cog|sv|katt}}), {{cog|goh|kazzo}}. The word existed in the Germanic languages in a female gender also, represented in Old Saxon by {{m|osx|katta}}. The word appears to be related to {{cog|LL.|cattus}} as well as to similar words in the Slavic and Celtic languages, but the ultimate source is uncertain.

{{also|pões}}
==English==

===Alternative forms===
* {{l|en|puss}}

===Etymology===
From {{bor|en|af|poes||vagina}}, from {{der|en|nl|poes||cat, female cat, vagina}}. {{doublet|en|puss}}.

===Pronunciation===
* {{IPA|en|/pus/}}
* {{rhymes|en|us}}

===Noun===
{{en-noun|?}}

# {{lb|en|South Africa|vulgar|slang}} The [[female]] [[genitalia]].
# {{lb|en|South Africa|vulgar|slang|derogatory}} A [[disliked]] person.

===Anagrams===
* {{anagrams|en|a=eops|ESOP|PEOs|epos|opes|peos|peso|pose|posé|sope}}

----

==Afrikaans==

===Etymology===
From {{inh|af|nl|poes||female cat, vagina}}.

===Pronunciation===
* {{IPA|af|/pus/}}

===Noun===
{{af-noun|poese|poesie|poeste}}

# {{lb|af|vulgar}} A [[vagina]]; [[female]] [[genitalia]].
# {{lb|af|derogatory|slang}} A [[cunt]]; [[douche]]; a contemptible person.

====Synonyms====
* {{l|af|doos}}
* {{l|af|kont}}
* {{l|af|kwas}}

====Descendants====
* {{desc|en|bor=1|poes}}

----

==Dutch==

===Alternative forms===
* {{alter|nl|puys||obsolete}}

===Etymology===
Ultimately from a common {{der|nl|gem}} word for cat, perhaps ultimately {{onomatopoeic|nl|title=imitative}} of a sound made to get its attention (compare {{noncog|ar|بسة}}). More at {{m|en|puss}}.

===Pronunciation===
* {{IPA|nl|/pus/}}
* {{audio|nl|Nl-poes.ogg|audio}}
* {{hyphenation|nl|poes}}
* {{rhymes|nl|us|s=1}}

===Noun===
{{nl-noun|f|-zen|poesje}}

# A female [[cat]].
#: {{syn|nl|kattin}}
# {{lb|nl|affectionate}} A cat of either sex.
# {{lb|nl|vulgar}} A [[vagina]], [[pussy]].
#* {{quote-book
|year=2007
|author=Herman Brusselmans
|title=De perfecte koppijn
|pageurl=https://books.google.com/books?id=a6kb1WYBC7IC&q=%22natte+poes%22
|isbn=9789044610987
|page=145
|publisher=Prometheus
|1=nl
|passage=Z'n moeder had er met geen mens over gepraat, zeker niet omdat ze een natte '''poes''' had gekregen toen ze tijdens het gesprek naar Justins kruis staarde.
|translation=His mother hadn't spoken about it with anyone, especially not because she got a wet '''pussy''' when she stared at Justin's crotch during the conversation.}}
#* {{quote-book
|year=2017
|author=Heleen Debruyne, Anais Van Ertvelde
|title=Vuile lakens: Een hedendaagse visie op seksualiteit
|pageurl=https://books.google.com/books?id=zPM-DwAAQBAJ&pg=PT136
|isbn=9789023464372
|page=136
|publisher=De Bezige Bij
|1=nl
|passage=Nu, een '''poes''' likken is tenminste nog een dienst die geleverd moet worden, enige inspanning vergt, en waarbij het fysieke plezier grotendeels voor de ander is.}}
#{{lb|nl|sometimes|derogatory}} A woman or girl.
#* {{quote-book
|year=1730
|author=Jacob Campo Weyerman
|title=Den vrolyke tuchtheer
|volume=1
|pageurl=https://books.google.com/books?id=lqdpAAAAcAAJ&pg=PA29
|isbn=
|page=29
|publisher=Joris vander Woude
|1=nl
|passage=Ook is die looze '''poes''' in 't Paradys gekomen, Wyl Adam ley gerust te droomen, Des zy hem tot een proef van haar goedaardig hart Een rib ontstal, 't begin van de algemeene smart.}}
#* {{quote-book
|year=1970
|author=Catalijn Claes
|title=Laaiend vuur op sintels
|pageurl=https://books.google.com/books?id=wA8EzDYqrwsC&q=%22hete+poes%22
|isbn=9789025700775
|page=21
|publisher=J.H. Gottmer
|1=nl
|passage=Ze is zoals ze zeggen een "hete '''poes'''" vader, en pas op als je je vingers aan haar brandt. Je zal de blaren voelen en niet zo zuinig ook.}}
#* {{quote-book
|year=2015
|author=Marnix Peeters
|title=De trapchauffeur
|pageurl=https://books.google.com/books?id=g8N3BQAAQBAJ&pg=PA46-IA1
|isbn=9789048825561
|page=46
|publisher=Overamstel Uitgevers
|1=nl|passage=Ge overdrijft. Woont die kleine met haar gekleurde haar nog onder u? vraagt David. Ik zeg: ik denk het wel. Weet ge nog altijd niet hoe die heet? vraagt David. Ge zijt zot, man, zo'n hete '''poes'''.}}
#* {{quote-book
|year=2016
|author=James Jones
|title=From here to eternity: de volledige en ongecensureerde editie
|pageurl=https://books.google.com/books?id=OIVCDAAAQBAJ&pg=PT317
|isbn=9789045208664
|translator=J.F. Kliphuis, De Vertalerij
|page=317
|publisher=Karakter
|1=nl|passage=Komt het omdat je al zo lang geen vrouw gehad hebt, dat je door de knieën gaat voor de eerste de beste hete '''poes''' die het handig aanpakt? Ja, dat zal het wel zijn, maar sta in godsnaam niet zo te stuntelen.}}
#* {{quote-book
|year=2020
|author=Aleksandr Skorobogatov
|title=De wasbeer
|pageurl=https://books.google.com/books?id=gRHPDwAAQBAJ&pg=PT400
|isbn=9789044542981
|page=400
|publisher=Singel Uitgeverijen
|1=nl
|passage=In het bijzijn van zo'n sekswolvin als u, o hete '''poes''' der liefde, zou enkel bij een granieten steen een fascist niet in de houding gaan staan.}}

====Usage notes====
In the sense “vagina” the diminutive form ({{m|nl|poesje}}) is highly common. As a term for a woman it can be interpreted as offensive or sexist depending on the context. Compounds are different, [[snoezepoes]] is not offensive but [[pitspoes]] is more likely to have sexist connotations.

====Derived terms====
* {{l|nl|niet voor de poes zijn}}
* {{l|nl|pitspoes}}
* {{l|nl|poeslief}}
* {{l|nl|poezebeest}}
* {{l|nl|poezelig}}
* {{l|nl|stoeipoes}}

====Descendants====
* {{desctree|af|poes}}
* {{desc|brc|[[pusi]], [[pusiki]]}}
* {{desc|id|bor=1|pus}}
* {{desc|pap|pushi|bor=1}}, {{l|pap|poesji}} {{q|from the diminutive}}
* {{desc|srn|puspusi|bor=1}}

====See also====
* {{l|nl|kat}}
* {{l|nl|kater}}

===Anagrams===
* {{l|nl|epos}}, {{l|nl|pose}}, {{l|nl|soep}}, {{l|nl|oeps}}, {{l|nl|peso}}, {{l|en|opes}}

===References===
* {{R:OED}}

==Sanskrit==

===Etymology===
{{root|sa|ine-pro|*dʰeh₁-}}
From {{inh|sa|inc-pro|*dádʰaHti}}, from {{inh|sa|iir-pro|*dʰádʰaHti}}, from {{inh|sa|ine-pro|*dʰédʰeh₁ti}}, from {{m|ine-pro|*dʰeh₁-||to put, place, set}}. Cognate with {{cog|grc|τίθημι}}, {{cog|la|faciō}}, {{cog|ang|dōn}} (whence {{cog|en|do}}).

===Pronunciation===
{{sa-IPA|a=1}}

===Verb===
{{sa-verb|tr=dádhāti|धा|3|UP|present}}

# to [[put]], [[place]], [[set]], lay in or on
# to inflict punishment on
# to put one's foot in another's footstep i.e. [[imitate]]
# to [[take]] or [[bring]] or [[help]] to
# to [[direct]] or [[fix]] the mind or attention upon, think of, fix or resolve upon
# to [[destine]] for, [[bestow]] on, [[present]] or [[impart]] to
# to [[appoint]], [[establish]], [[constitute]]
# to [[render]]
# to [[make]], [[produce]], [[generate]], [[create]], [[cause]], [[effect]], [[perform]], [[execute]]
# to [[seize]], take hold of, [[hold]], [[bear]], [[support]], [[wear]], put on (clothes)
# to [[accept]], [[obtain]], [[conceive]] (especially in the womb), to take pleasure or delight in
# to [[assume]], [[have]], [[possess]], [[show]], [[exhibit]], [[incur]], [[undergo]]
# to wish to put in or lay on
# to wish to give or present
# to wish to gain, strive after
# to [[bid]] defiance

====Descendants====
* Dardic:
** {{desc|kls|dyek}}
* {{desc|pi|dahati}}

===References===
* {{R:sa:MW|513}}

==Old High German==

===Alternative forms===
* {{alter|goh|wazar|wazzer|waszer}}

===Etymology===
From {{inh|goh|gem-pro|*watōr}}, whence also {{cog|odt|-}} and {{cog|osx|watar}}, {{cog|ang|wæter}}, {{cog|ofs|weter}}, {{cog|non|vatn}}. Ultimately from {{inh|goh|ine-pro|*wódr̥}}.

===Pronunciation===
* {{IPA|goh|/wasːar/}}

===Noun===
{{goh-noun|n}}

# [[water]]

====Declension====
{{goh-decl-noun-a-n|wazzar}}

====Descendants====
* {{desctree|gmh|wazzer|waȥȥer}}

===References===
# Joseph Wright, ''An Old High German Primer'', second edition
# Köbler, Gerhard, ''Althochdeutsches Wörterbuch'', (6. Auflage) 2014

==Gothic==

===Etymology===
From {{inh|got|gem-pro|*watōr}}, the stem of which alternated between ending in ''-r'' and ''-n''. Note that the stem in Gothic has undergone some changes, losing the final ''-r'' in the nominative and accusative singular (presumably to [[w:Morphological leveling|resemble the inflection]] of neuter an-stem nouns more closely). The contracted plurals, however, are preserved. Unlike most Germanic languages (with the exception of North Germanic; cf. {{cog|non|vatn}}), Gothic also preserves the alternate ''-n'' stem for the oblique cases. Other Germanic languages typically leveled the paradigms of this word to be based entirely on the ''-r'' stem (for example, {{cog|ang|wæter}}, genitive {{m|ang|wæteres}}).

===Noun===
{{got-noun|n}}

# [[water]]

====Declension====
{{got-decl-wato}}

[[Cat:got:Food and drink]]
[[Cat:got:Water]]

==Dutch==

===Etymology===
From earlier {{m|nl|vaten}}, from {{inh|nl|dum|vaten}}, from {{inh|nl|odt|*faton}}, from {{inh|nl|gem-pro|*fatōną}}. Equivalent to {{affix|nl|vat|-en|id2=denominative}}. The short ''a'' was introduced by analogy with the uninflected singular form of the noun {{m|nl|vat}}.

===Etymology===

===Noun===
{{head|xum|noun|sc=Ital|ablative|𐌖𐌍𐌄}}

# [[water]]

===References===
<references/>

* James Clackson, ''Indo-European Linguistics: An Introduction'', page 34: "'''water' {{...}} Umbrian utur''"
